content.raw:
Since the resulting read string is going to be potentially manipulated in Python, the question becomes whether or not we want to return standard Python strings or the lower level ‘bytes’ type. From Python 3 onwards it would seem to make the most sense to allow reading in as Unicode/UTF-8 since it’s encoding is equivalent to any ASCII we are reading and we can use the Python string manipulations as-is.

We could add a “mode” argument here but I would think that the default should be “rt” and not “rb”. If default ends up being “rb” then I believe almost all calls to ‘maybe\_gzip\_open’ will override it with the “rt” option.
